newsitem.title: SRI LANKA: Sri Lanka rupee seen in tight range vs dollar.
newsitem.headline: Sri Lanka rupee seen in tight range vs dollar.

text.p: The Sri Lanka rupee was expected to trade in a narrow range against the dollar on Tuesday because of a lack of commercial demand, dealers said.
At 0430 GMT, the rupee was at 58.43 to the greenback after opening at 58.45. On Monday, the rupee closed at 58.46.
The central bank fixed buying and selling at 58.4026 and 59.5824, respectively.
"There should be a big bill for the market to move up. But at the moment, we are not seing anything," said a Standard Chartered Bank dealer.
Dealers said banks with big dollar positions were holding on, waiting for the greenback to reach the 58.50-level before they started selling.
But given that the dollar was not strengthening aggressively overseas and given the lack of commercial demand, the greenback was not likely to reach that level soon, dealers said.
Overnight call money, which opened at 11 percent was down to 9.75 percent. --Colombo newsroom (941) 434319
